conclusion: From 0 s to 10 s the (v-t) graph shows the magnitude of the sky-diver’s velocity steadily increasing—the slope of the curve is positive all the way to the peak at 10 s.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity.

premise: The slope of the v-t graph is positive from 0 s to 10 s.
conclusion: A positive slope means the acceleration vector points in the same direction as the chosen positive velocity direction.
During free-fall, the direction is downward, since gravity acts downward and exceeds air-resistance during this early portion of the descent.

premise: A positive slope means the acceleration vector points in the same direction as the chosen positive velocity direction. During free-fall, the direction is downward.
conclusion: During the 0 s to 10 s interval the sky-diver’s acceleration is directed downward.
